And now that we are done with these let's go ahead and learn about variance and standard deviation.
So when we talk about variance in simple terms variance is nothing but a measure of how far
the data point lies from the mean of the sample or population. To calculate the variance of a sample
we will follow the formula shown in the picture over here that we can see to calculate the variance
we will subtract sample mean from the actual value and divide it from the number of observations
in the sample. The square and we are going to square the outcome and we will perform this for
all the values. So that is how we calculate the variance of any sample. Now coming back to
standard deviation when it comes to standard deviation it is calculated by computing the square
root of the variance. It also gives the estimation of how far the data is dispersed from the sample
or population mean. But the difference between variance and standard deviation is that the standard
deviation is calculated in the same unit as original values. Therefore it can give us a more
rigid explanation of how the spread of the data is distributed. So when we have to check the spread
of the data we make use of standard deviation and variance. So for central tendencies we are using
